If you either main survivor or are 100% tilt-proof, this game is awesome. Cool lore, amazing gameplay, each killer and survivor feel really good to play and it's pretty immersive. If you're looking for a really scary horror game, this isn't it, but if you're looking for a fun competitive experience, you got it.

That being said, if you play killer primarily, be prepared for an absolute shitshow of an experience. The devs have massively favored survivors at every point throughout this game's history, and still do. Despite this, most survivors seem to think they are the second coming because they know basic looping. It starts to ramp up around Rank 16 and by the time you hit red ranks it is so much worse. Constant teabagging, moonwalking, emote spam, and bodyblocking everywhere you look. Additionally, survivors can queue up together using Discord comms as 4. These players can be placed in your game randomly instead of solo queue players for an unknown reason. Not only do these SwF groups tend to be even more toxic than most solo queue players, but the game basically becomes "bully a killer simulator", allowing survivors to coordinate everything, be constantly aware of your whereabouts, bodyblock you from being able to hook anyone, and generally juke you in ways far more efficient than were actually planned for this game. Also, expect to get flamed in the post-game chat as killer no matter what. If you lost, every survivor in the match will spam "GG EZ NOOB KILLER". If you win, you are immediately accused of camping and tunneling, even if you did no such thing. By supposedly using such heinous strategies, your win is now invalid and the survivors are better anyway. Be prepared to receive both death threats and people telling you to kill yourself on a regular basis, whether in the post-game lobby or on your Steam profile. Also, every time survivors lose a match, after sending a death threat or two, they will immediately go to the forums, subreddit, discord, etc. and whine about the killer being overpowered. The devs immediately respond, and nerf the role even further.

So, to sum it up, my recommendation depends entirely on which role you play and how tilt-proof you are. Overall, it is a great game, and I commend that. Sadly, the community for this game, particularly survivor mains, are one of the most toxic to ever exist. At this point, I am convinced that I have a more intense hatred for survivors than the killers I play as.

As a player of this game with as of now 1,400 hours, this game is still fresh and unique even after all these years. This may come as a shock if you've read the game description: you need to complete 5 gens and open a gate, and the killer must catch you and put you on hooks till you die. Sounds basic right? (no) RIGHT!? (WRONG!!). This game is overflowing with new things to try, for starters there's approximately 30-35 maps with 20-odd different biomes, in those maps are various different obstacles which all have a range of mindgames on each to learn, both survivor and killer sided. There's also all the in-game knowledge you must amass such as how to predict what your teammates are doing (based on in-game practices and stereotypes alike) or what you should prioritise based on what objectives require completion. All this is then flipped over to the killers side, and on top of all of that you have the killers specific powers (unique to each killer). There's also items to bring in, mori's and other offerings, playing in comms with friends, toxic antics, various perk builds and more and more and more the amount that you are capable to partake in is overwhelming.

There is an achievement called 'left for dead' wherein, as the last player alive you have to complete the last gen and open an exit gate to escape. In all my 1,400 hours on pc (and 2,500 on console) I never got this achievement; all those invested hours and the experience of completing this still eludes me. I have also never been matched with a pig in midwich, or a demo on haddonfield; the day i get to experience these is also a while away., Not to mention the hours and further hours i need to invest to get good with the other half of the killers (and even with all of this i still can't moonwalk).

This game is still brimming with life even after all the years i've been in the community. So as a newcomer, by christ it'll be amazing for you to experience this. I highly recommend this game from the bottom of my heart as a single player or a friend group. You'll get a vast amount of fun playtime for the amount you pay for.

The game has a fun concept but the execution is more than sad. 
The devs encourage toxic gameplay and make the game unfun in higher ranks (Both for killer and survivor)
The game has game breaking addons, item and offerings that no game competetive game should ever have. Solo survivor is a nightmare. Camping&tunneling remain unpunished and shit like object, noed, meta swf, moris, keys, stuff like tombstone, iri heads or any other massively op addon have been in the game for ages and nothing is being done. I regret all the money i spent on this mess. This game is simply no fun unless you are full meta swf or toxic yourself.

this game is soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo horror damn i almost die like stupid people

Bom pra caralho, mas se tu quer se divertir tenta nÃ£o jogar de killer, porque se tu cai contra 4 neguin em call com build forte tu vai se sentir mais humilhado que rabo de dama da noite depois de fazer orgia com negÃµes. Mas se vocÃª tiver um certo nÃ­vel de masoquismo, vai fundo.

8/10 - balanceia esse jogo behavior filha da puta, os desenvolvedor Ã© tudo main survivor
Awesome game to play with pals, and community always gets active during halloween. Great time to get spooked out 8/10

I've never seen a game with such a GREAT concept be managed by absolute melvins, and a community (myself included) that ruins nearly every game. The odds of getting a normal game from start to finish, with nobody acting a fool or the game bugging for one reason or another, is incredibly rare. A MASSIVE grind for new players, yet every game contains the same 15 perks. Hitboxes are laughable.

Wonderful, interesting game. Hateful online community full of trolls. It's gone unaddressed for so long that there is a huge dearth of killers because of the subculture of survivor existing purely to troll, aggravate and exploit every loophole to make sure that the bad guy is always punished. I have gone hard on it twice over the years, and left it every time over exhaustion and aggravation. I truly regret the money I spent on the DLC.

The Entity is a web of assholes. The only way to not get caught is not to play.
